Package mmj.lang

Class Sym

java.lang.Object
mmj.lang.MObj
mmj.lang.Sym
Direct Known Subclasses:
Cnst, Var
public abstract class Sym extends MObj
Sym holds a declared Metamath symbol and is the base class for Cnst and Var.

In mmj there is only one occurrence of each symbol, and this includes constants and variables. For example, there is only one "(".

See Also:

    • isActive

      public abstract boolean isActive()
      Is Sym active?

      Cnsts are always active as they cannot be defined inside a scope level, but a Var defined in a scope level is "inactive" outside of that scope.

      The question "is Sym 'x' active" has relevance only in relation to a Stmt: only "active" Syms can be used in a given Stmt's Formula.

      Returns:
      is Sym "active"

    • toString

    • equals

      public boolean equals(Object obj)
      Compare for equality with another Sym.

      Equal if and only if the Sym id strings are equal. and the obj to be compared to this object is not null and is a Sym as well.

      Note that "equals" is identical to "==" for Sym and Stmt MObj's.

      Overrides:
      equals in class MObj
      Parameters:
      obj - another Sym -- otherwise will return false.
      Returns:
      returns true if equal, otherwise false.
